items.title: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuelan drug trade. And, judge pauses shutdown layoffs
items.standfirst: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuela by authorizing covert CIA operations. And, a federal judge halts the Trump administration's shutdown layoffs.
items.content: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuela by authorizing covert CIA operations. And, a federal judge halts the Trump administration's shutdown layoffs.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

items.title: US president authorised covert CIA operations in Venezuela
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has tried to brand himself as a peacemaker in the Middle East but he has stoked tensions with Venezuela in recent months. In August 2025, he sent warships to the Caribbean to combat alleged drug trafficking. Speaking to reporters on October 15, 2025, he said he had approved CIA covert actions in Venezuela and was considering strikes on its territory.
items.content: President Donald Trump has tried to brand himself as a peacemaker in the Middle East but he has stoked tensions with Venezuela in recent months. In August 2025, he sent warships to the Caribbean to combat alleged drug trafficking. Speaking to reporters on October 15, 2025, he said he had approved CIA covert actions in Venezuela and was considering strikes on its territory.

items.title: Trump says he authorized covert CIA operations in Venezuela as Maduro decries the move as ‘coups d’etat’
items.standfirst: Move marks escalation in Maduro pressure campaign as president says US mulling strikes on Venezuelan territoryDonald Trump said on Wednesday he had authorized the CIA to carry out covert operations in Venezuela, marking a sharp escalation in his administration’s pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro’s government.Trump further suggested he was considering strikes on Venezuelan territory, a dramatic step that would go beyond a series of recent lethal attacks on boats in the Caribbean, which Democrats and United Nations experts have forcefully condemned as unlawful. Continue reading...

items.title: French government will have to find compromise with MPs to get budget through
items.standfirst: After surviving the riskiest of two motions of no-confidence in Parliament, the French government will now have to work to find compromise with MPs to settle on a budget before the end of the year. Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu promised he would not be using the 49.3 law, which allows to force legislation through without requiring Parliamentary votes. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman breaks down what's ahead.
items.content: After surviving the riskiest of two motions of no-confidence in Parliament, the French government will now have to work to find compromise with MPs to settle on a budget before the end of the year. Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu promised he would not be using the 49.3 law, which allows to force legislation through without requiring Parliamentary votes. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman breaks down what's ahead.

items.standfirst: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu survived a first vote of no confidence in France's National Assembly on Thursday after pledging to suspend a controversial pension reform.The motion, introduced by the...
items.content: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu survived a first vote of no confidence in France's National Assembly on Thursday after pledging to suspend a controversial pension reform.The motion, introduced by the...

items.title: French PM Sébastien Lecornu survives no-confidence vote in Parliament
items.standfirst: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu narrowly survived the riskiest of two votes of no-confidence, by 18 votes. His survival is largely due to the Socialist Party's decision to temporarily support the government after Lecornu promised to suspend France's controversial 2022 pension reform. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan tells us more from the French National Assembly.
items.content: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu narrowly survived the riskiest of two votes of no-confidence, by 18 votes. His survival is largely due to the Socialist Party's decision to temporarily support the government after Lecornu promised to suspend France's controversial 2022 pension reform. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan tells us more from the French National Assembly.

items.title: French Prime Minister Lecornu Survives No-Confidence Motion
Live: French PM Lecornu survives no-confidence votes after pension reform concession
items.standfirst: France's reappointed Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu survived successive no-confidence votes in the National Assembly on Thursday, drawing enough support from moderates to avert a second government collapse in as many weeks. Lecornu's offer to suspend an unpopular pension reform helped sway the opposition Socialists, giving his government a lifeline in the deeply fragmented chamber. Follow live for the latest.
items.content: France's reappointed Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu survived successive no-confidence votes in the National Assembly on Thursday, drawing enough support from moderates to avert a second government collapse in as many weeks. Lecornu's offer to suspend an unpopular pension reform helped sway the opposition Socialists, giving his government a lifeline in the deeply fragmented chamber. Follow live for the latest.

items.title: Will France's new government survive the no-confidence vote?
items.standfirst: France's Prime Minister is to face a vote of no confidence on October 16, 2025 after the left and far-right announced it would test the current government. Socialists are momentarily backing Sebastien Lecornu following changes to pension plans, but a number of them have said they will still vote for the motion of no confidence citing austerity measures that remain in his budget proposal for 2026. James Vasina, Florent Marchais and our colleagues at France 2 have more on the story.
items.content: France's Prime Minister is to face a vote of no confidence on October 16, 2025 after the left and far-right announced it would test the current government. Socialists are momentarily backing Sebastien Lecornu following changes to pension plans, but a number of them have said they will still vote for the motion of no confidence citing austerity measures that remain in his budget proposal for 2026. James Vasina, Florent Marchais and our colleagues at France 2 have more on the story.

ai_summary: French Prime Minister Lecornu survived two no-confidence votes.
The government secured narrow backing from lawmakers.
The first motion was put forward by La France Insoumise.
Parliament will begin debating the 2026 budget.
Lecornu promised not to use the 49.3 law.

clusters.title: Who is Michael Randrianirina, set to become Madagascar's new president?
clusters.neutral_headline: Madagascar Military Leader Set to Be Sworn In

items.title: Who is Michael Randrianirina, set to become Madagascar's new president?
items.standfirst: He is set to become Madagascar's new president after mass protests led to the toppling of Andry Rajoelina. But who is the colonel Michael Randrianirina, who has become the face of the country's latest power grab? He has vowed to 'quickly' appoint a new civilian prime minister and to hold elections within two years. In the meantime, he announced the creation of a military council composed of army and police officers to lead the country.
items.content: He is set to become Madagascar's new president after mass protests led to the toppling of Andry Rajoelina. But who is the colonel Michael Randrianirina, who has become the face of the country's latest power grab? He has vowed to 'quickly' appoint a new civilian prime minister and to hold elections within two years. In the meantime, he announced the creation of a military council composed of army and police officers to lead the country.

items.title: AU suspends Madagascar as military leader to be sworn in as president

items.content: Colonel Randrianirina set to assume presidency in Madagascar after President Andry Rajoelina removed.

items.title: African Union suspends Madagascar as military leader set to be sworn in as president
items.standfirst: Army assumed power after parliament voted to impeach Andry Rajoelina following widespread protestsMadagascar’s new military ruler will be sworn in as the country’s president on Friday, the military said on Wednesday, as the African Union suspended the island nation after a coup that ousted President Andry Rajoelina.The Indian Ocean nation has been plunged into its worst political upheaval in years after the elite Capsat army unit assumed power on Tuesday, moments after parliament voted to impeach Rajoelina, who appeared to have fled the country as street protests escalated. Continue reading...
items.content: Army assumed power after parliament voted to impeach Andry Rajoelina following widespread protestsMadagascar’s new military ruler will be sworn in as the country’s president on Friday, the military said on Wednesday, as the African Union suspended the island nation after a coup that ousted President Andry Rajoelina.The Indian Ocean nation has been plunged into its worst political upheaval in years after the elite Capsat army unit assumed power on Tuesday, moments after parliament voted to impeach Rajoelina, who appeared to have fled the country as street protests escalated. Continue reading...

items.title: Elite military unit says it has seized power in Madagascar
items.standfirst: Announcement comes after country’s parliament impeaches president after weeks of anti-government protestsAn elite military unit said it had taken power in Madagascar on Tuesday, after the country’s parliament impeached president Andry Rajoelina after weeks of anti-government protests.Rajoelina, who said on Monday in a Facebook Live video that he had gone into hiding after attempts to kill him, had refused demands to step down, but the demonstrators won the backing of the influential Capsat unit at the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: Announcement comes after country’s parliament impeaches president after weeks of anti-government protestsAn elite military unit said it had taken power in Madagascar on Tuesday, after the country’s parliament impeached president Andry Rajoelina after weeks of anti-government protests.Rajoelina, who said on Monday in a Facebook Live video that he had gone into hiding after attempts to kill him, had refused demands to step down, but the demonstrators won the backing of the influential Capsat unit at the weekend. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Michael Randrianirina is set to become Madagascar's new president.
The African Union suspended Madagascar after the coup.
An elite military unit seized power in Madagascar.
Parliament impeached President Andry Rajoelina.
Randrianirina will be sworn in as president on Friday.

items.title: Hamas says all reachable hostage bodies recovered amid Israel threat to resume Gaza fighting
items.standfirst: Hamas says it needs specialist equipment to recover remaining bodies as Israel’s defence minister threatens to resume fightingGaza ceasefire – live updatesPalestinian leader Marwan Barghouti assaulted by Israeli prison guards, son saysIsrael has threatened to resume fighting in Gaza after Hamas announced that it could not return any further remains of deceased Israeli hostages without specialist recovery equipment that is needed to retrieve the rest from the ruins of the devastated territory.The threat from Israel Katz, the defence minister, came after Hamas handed over the remains of two further bodies late on Wednesday, bringing the total of known deceased hostages returned by Hamas to nine – along with a tenth body that Israel said was not that of a former hostage. Continue reading...

items.title: Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouti assaulted by Israeli prison guards, son says
items.standfirst: Family fears for 66-year-old’s life after assault while he was being transferred between prisonsPalestine’s most popular leader, Marwan Barghouti, was beaten unconscious by Israeli prison guards and his family fears for his life, his son has said, citing evidence given by former Palestinian detainees released this week as part of the ceasefire deal.Arab Barghouti said his 66-year-old father was assaulted by eight guards on 14 September as he was being transferred between Ganot and Megiddo prisons. Continue reading...

items.content: A new lawsuit alleges Bank of America profited from its dealings with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

clusters.title: Trump threatens Hamas after group suggests no more hostage bodies can be returned
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump threatens Hamas after hostage body return concerns

items.title: Trump threatens Hamas after group suggests no more hostage bodies can be returned
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has warned the war in Gaza could resume if Hamas doesn't uphold its end of the ceasefire deal, amid uncertainty over whether the group can return the remaining bodies of Israeli hostages.
items.content: Donald Trump has warned the war in Gaza could resume if Hamas doesn't uphold its end of the ceasefire deal, amid uncertainty over whether the group can return the remaining bodies of Israeli hostages.

items.title: Hamas returns remains of two more hostages, says 'significant efforts' needed to retrieve others
items.standfirst: A body Hamas returned to Israel as part of President Trump's ceasefire deal is not that of any of the hostages, the Israel Defense Forces said Wednesday.
items.content: A body Hamas returned to Israel as part of President Trump's ceasefire deal is not that of any of the hostages, the Israel Defense Forces said Wednesday.

items.title: Hamas returns remains of four more hostages as Israel returns 45 deceased Palestinians, Red Cross says
items.standfirst: Hamas returned the remains of four more hostages to Israeli authorities and Israel returned the remains of 45 Palestinians to Gaza on Tuesday, according to the International Committee of the Red Cross, as President Donald Trump warned the militant group that it must disarm.
items.content: Hamas returned the remains of four more hostages to Israeli authorities and Israel returned the remains of 45 Palestinians to Gaza on Tuesday, according to the International Committee of the Red Cross, as President Donald Trump warned the militant group that it must disarm.

ai_summary: Trump warned Hamas regarding the Gaza ceasefire deal.
Hamas has returned remains of some hostages to Israel.
Israel returned remains of deceased Palestinians to Gaza.
The IDF confirmed one returned body was not a hostage.
Trump stated Hamas must disarm to uphold the ceasefire.

clusters.title: ChatGPT erotica coming soon with age verification, CEO says
clusters.neutral_headline: ChatGPT to allow erotica for verified adults, says CEO

items.title: ChatGPT erotica coming soon with age verification, CEO says
items.standfirst: Sam Altman claims new tools can detect mental distress while relaxing limits for adults.
items.content: On Tuesday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced that the company will allow verified adult users to have erotic conversations with ChatGPT starting in December. The change represents a shift in how OpenAI approaches content restrictions, which the company had loosened in February but then dramatically tightened after an August lawsuit from parents of a teen who died by suicide after allegedly receiving encouragement from ChatGPT. "In December, as we roll out age-gating more fully and as part of our 'treat adult users like adults' principle, we will allow even more, like erotica for verified adults," Altman wrote in his post on X (formerly Twitter). The announcement follows OpenAI's recent hint that it would allow developers to create "mature" ChatGPT applications once the company implements appropriate age verification and controls. Altman explained that OpenAI had made ChatGPT "pretty restrictive to make sure we were being careful with mental health issues" but acknowledged this approach made the chatbot "less useful/enjoyable to many users who had no mental health problems." The CEO said the company now has new tools to better detect when users are experiencing mental distress, allowing OpenAI to relax restrictions in most cases.Read full article Comments

items.title: ChatGPT will soon allow erotica for verified adults, says OpenAI boss
items.standfirst: CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way - "but only if you want it".
items.content: CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way - "but only if you want it".

ai_summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced erotica features for ChatGPT.
The new features will require age verification for users.
Altman stated tools will detect mental distress in users.
The changes aim to make ChatGPT more human-like.
The erotica features will only be available to adults.

items.title: Apple Launches iPad Pro, Vision Pro and MacBook Pro With M5 Chip

Apple also updated the Vision Pro and entry-level MacBook Pro.
The new devices feature the new M5 chip.
The updates come ahead of the holiday season.
